item.title: 牛市由美国以外的股票推动
item.description:
全球股市自二月份以来首次创下历史新高。【原文：

Global equities top record highs for the first time since February. 

】

item.title: 全球石油价格下跌，俄罗斯石油收入降至两年来最低点
item.description: 由于全球原油价格下跌，俄罗斯国家预算中的石油收入上个月缩减至 2023 年 6 月以来的最低水平。【原文：Russia’s proceeds from oil in the state budget shrank last month to the lowest since June 2023 as global crude prices declined.】

item.title: 世界最佳货币令加纳通胀降至 2022 年以来最低点
item.description: 加纳的通货膨胀率降至三年多来的最低水平，这是因为该国的世界货币升值有助于降低进口成本。【原文：Ghana’s inflation rate dropped to the lowest level in more than three years, as the country’s world-beating currency helped reduce the cost of imports.】

item.title: 挪威5月份房价持平，房地产市场趋冷
item.description: 挪威上个月调整后的房价保持不变，这进一步证明，随着货币宽松政策的推迟，市场正在从近期的涨势中得到喘息。【原文：Norway’s adjusted home prices stayed put last month, adding evidence that the market is taking a break from a recent rally as monetary easing is postponed.】

item.title: 泰国承诺采取措施防止赌场洗钱活动
item.description: 泰国官员表示，泰国计划记录和监控赌场游客的金融交易，以阻止洗钱行为，政府正试图赢得反对者的支持，通过一项法案将赌博场所合法化，作为新的综合度假胜地的一部分。【原文：Thailand plans to record and monitor financial transactions of visitors to casinos to deter money laundering, officials said as the government sought to win over opponents of a bill to legalize gambling venues as part of new integrated resorts.】

item.title: 欧洲需求激增，2024 年以色列国防出口创纪录
item.description: 以色列的国防出口连续第四年创下历史新高，这主要归功于欧洲不断增长的需求，尽管以色列的一些国家呼吁对加沙战争实施制裁。【原文：Israel’s defense exports hit a record for a fourth consecutive year thanks largely to growing demand from Europe, even as some of its nations call for sanctions over the war in Gaza.】

item.title: 特斯拉致命车祸显示了全自动驾驶的局限性
item.description:
就在埃隆-马斯克在奥斯汀吹捧机器人出租车时，联邦监管机构正在调查特斯拉的系统即使在有人驾驶的情况下是否也很危险。【原文：

As Elon Musk touts robotaxis in Austin, federal regulators are investigating whether Tesla’s system is dangerous even with a human behind the wheel.

】

item.title: 人工智能对电力的迫切需求促使更脏的燃气轮机回归
item.description: 如果星际之门的首个人工智能数据中心按计划于明年竣工，那么这个占地 900 英亩的场地所需的全天候电力将足以支持 30 万户家庭。但确保电力供应并不像接入电网那么简单。【原文：If Stargate’s first AI data center is completed next year as planned, the 900-acre site will need enough round-the-clock electricity to support 300,000 homes. But securing that power isn’t as simple as plugging into the grid.】

item.title: Switch 2 到货，预计商店将大排长龙，网站将繁忙不堪
item.description: 任天堂公司将于周四在全球发布 Switch 2，这是该公司八年来推出的第一款新游戏系统。【原文：Nintendo Co. will release the Switch 2, its first new gaming system in eight years, in a global launch Thursday that’s expected to produce lines at stores from Hong Kong to Houston and frantic visits to online shopping sites.】

item.title: Salesforce 的耐心和首席执行官之间的关系推动了 Informatica 的收购
item.description: Salesforce 公司同意以 80 亿美元的价格收购 Informatica 公司，而在此之前一年，最初的谈判已经破裂，收购目标失去了三分之一的市值，降低了愿意接受的交易价格。【原文：Salesforce Inc.’s agreement to buy Informatica Inc. for $8 billion came a year after initial talks collapsed and the acquisition target lost a third of its market value, lowering the price it was willing to accept for a deal.】

item.title: 意大利联合信贷银行就收购 BPM 银行与意大利进行 "建设性 "谈判
item.description: 意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit SpA）表示，正在与意大利政府就其收购 Banco BPM SpA 的条件进行 "建设性 "谈判，这表明在双方数周的对峙之后，谈判的基调趋于和解。【原文：UniCredit SpA said it’s in “constructive” talks with Italy’s government over the conditions imposed on its bid to take over Banco BPM SpA, signaling a more conciliatory tone after weeks of confrontation between the two sides.】

item.title: 新兴股市因全球乐观情绪而上涨，韩国引领涨势
item.description: 受强劲的美国劳动力数据提振，新兴市场股市连续第二个交易日上涨，使全球股市创下历史新高。【原文：Emerging-market stocks gained for a second straight session, buoyed by strong US labor data that lifted global equities to a record high.】

item.title: 纽伯格表示，私募股权投资行业今年的退出将再遇低迷
item.description: Neuberger Berman 欧洲私募股权投资主管 Joana Rocha Scaff 表示，由于美国经济的不确定性增加，私募股权投资公司今年的退出活动可能会比较平淡。【原文：Private equity firms are likely to see muted exit activity this year on the back of increasing uncertainty over the US economy, according to Joana Rocha Scaff, head of European private equity at Neuberger Berman.】

item.title: 萨瓦德尔交易让西班牙桑切斯陷入政治困境
item.description: 西班牙试图阻止 BBVA SA 的收购计划，这正成为首相佩德罗-桑切斯（Pedro Sanchez）头疼的问题。【原文：Spain’s attempt to get in the way of BBVA SA’s acquisition plans is becoming an unwanted headache for Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez.】

item.title: 阿联酋与科威特签署价值 25 亿美元的导弹艇供应协议
item.description: 阿联酋防务公司 EDGE Group PJSC 签署了一项价值 24.5 亿美元的协议，为科威特提供一支导弹艇舰队，凸显了阿拉伯联合酋长国在本土军事能力方面的进步。【原文：Emirati defense company EDGE Group PJSC signed a $2.45 billion deal to supply Kuwait with a fleet of missile boats, highlighting the United Arab Emirates’ advances in homegrown military capabilities.】

item.title: 美国经济在就业数据公布前抵制关税安抚交易员
item.description: 期权交易商押注，在周五的美国就业报告公布后，标普500指数将创下几个月来的最小波动幅度，这凸显了一系列好于预期的数据如何平息了投资者对唐纳德-特朗普总统关税对经济影响的担忧。【原文：Options traders are betting the S&P 500 Index will post its smallest swing in months following Friday’s US employment report, highlighting how a spate of better-than-expected data has calmed investor worries over the economic impact of President Donald Trump’s tariffs.】

item.title: 俄罗斯雨天基金五月损失约 60 亿美元
item.description: 由于乌克兰战争支出的增加和石油价格的下跌挤压了预算，俄罗斯国家财富基金的流动资产（该国的雨天储备）在 5 月份下降了 14%。【原文：Liquid assets in Russia’s National Wealth Fund, the country’s rainy-day reserves, declined by 14% in May, as increasing spending on the war in Ukraine and falling oil prices squeeze the budget.】

item.title: 黄金反弹推动英国典当行拉姆斯登斯创下创纪录收益
item.description: 典当和金融服务提供商拉姆斯登斯控股公司（Ramsdens Holdings Plc）上调了全年业绩展望，因为黄金价格的飙升使其上半年盈利创下了历史新高。【原文：Pawnbroker and financial services provider Ramsdens Holdings Plc raised its full-year outlook after the skyrocketing price of gold sent its first-half earnings to a record.】

item.title: 多伦多房价止跌回升，买家开始表现出兴趣
item.description: 随着加美贸易紧张局势的缓解，多伦多房价在连续 5 个月下跌后出现回升，而处于 4 年来最低点的估值也开始吸引买家。【原文：Toronto home prices ticked up after five straight months of declines as Canada-US trade tensions eased and valuations at their lowest point in four years began to tempt buyers.】

item.title: 投资者押注辛鲍姆能在其他人失败的地方拯救墨西哥石油公司
item.description: 对于一家债务缠身的公司来说，墨西哥石油公司（Petroleos Mexicanos SA）正迎来一波罕见的投资者乐观情绪。买家们正在抢购这家钻探公司的债券，他们相信公司总裁克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）能够稳定公司财务，恢复这家国有巨头的信誉。【原文：For a company drowning in debt, Petroleos Mexicanos SA is enjoying a rare wave of investor optimism. Buyers are snapping up the driller’s bonds, betting President Claudia Sheinbaum can stabilize its finances and restore credibility for the state-owned giant.】

item.title: 印度在汽车关税问题上挑战美国，贸易立场趋于强硬
item.description: 印度周二正式就美国提高汽车关税问题向世界贸易组织提出质疑，表明这个南亚国家在贸易谈判中的立场更加强硬，即使两国正在为在 7 月前达成一项临时协议而努力。【原文：India on Tuesday formally challenged the US on higher auto tariffs by raising the matter with the World Trade Organization, signaling a hardening of the South Asian nation’s stance on trade talks even as the two countries race to clinch an interim deal before July.】

item.title: 不列颠哥伦比亚省合作伙伴公司称，美国的困境引发人们转向欧洲和更安全的行业
item.description: BC Partners 欧洲公司董事长尼科斯-斯塔索普洛斯（Nikos Stathopoulos）表示，由于动荡局势拖累了私人市场和交易，投资者正被吸引到服务业和其他更易受全球关税影响的行业。【原文：Investors are being drawn to services and other sectors that are more immune to global tariffs, as volatility weighs down private markets and dealmaking, according to BC Partners Europe Chairman Nikos Stathopoulos.】

item.title: 埃及通胀加速，央行正考虑进一步削减开支
item.description: 埃及通胀率连续第三个月加速上升，超出预期，这可能会使央行在延长货币宽松周期时更加谨慎。【原文：Egyptian inflation accelerated for a third month, exceeding estimates and potentially making the central bank more cautious in extending a monetary-easing cycle.】

item.title: 英国采购经理人指数显示，英国企业在与美国达成协议后更加乐观
item.description: 一项受到密切关注的调查显示，在达成缓解英美贸易紧张局势的协议后，英国企业的乐观情绪在 5 月份反弹至工党首次预算案后的最高水平。【原文：UK business optimism rebounded in May to its highest level since the aftermath of Labour’s first budget after a deal to ease trade tensions between Britain and the US, according to a closely watched survey.】

item.title: 李明博的财政支出计划令韩国债券承压
item.description: 随着人们越来越担心韩国左翼新总统将开创一个伴随着政府债务上升的财政扩张时代，韩国债券正面临着更艰难的时期。【原文：South Korean bonds are facing tougher times ahead, as concerns grow that the country’s left-leaning new president will usher in an era of fiscal expansion accompanied by rising government debt.】

item.title: 海尔金融为未评级中国企业获得首笔 Samurai 贷款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，海尔金融服务公司（Haier Financial Services Co.【原文：Haier Financial Services Co. is adding to a surge of interest in Samurai loans with a ¥29.9 billion ($208 million) deal, according to people familiar with the matter, marking the first such financing for an unrated Chinese borrower.】

item.title: 沙特银行疯狂举债以继续为巨型项目提供资金
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯的银行正急于发行高风险债务，因为沙特王国正在努力应对建设未来主义新城和举办全球体育赛事的庞大开支需求。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s banks are rushing to issue risky debt as the kingdom grapples with the mammoth spending demands of building a futuristic new city and hosting global sporting events.】

item.title: 泰国在现代化进程中购买 12 架瑞典鹰狮战斗机
item.description: 泰国皇家空军计划购买 12 架瑞典制造的 "鹰狮"（Gripen）战斗机，作为其军队现代化更广泛计划的一部分。【原文：The Royal Thai Air Force plans to acquire 12 Swedish-made Gripen fighter jets as part of a broader plan to modernize its military.】

item.title: 欧洲 T+1 转型的成本预计高于美国
item.description: 与美国相比，欧洲向更快结算机制过渡的成本可能会更高，因为该地区复杂的市场基础设施需要更庞大的团队来指导这一过程。【原文：Europe’s transition to a faster settlement regime will likely be more expensive than in the US, as the region’s complex market infrastructure requires larger teams to steer the process.】

item.title: 投资者对欧洲的新发现之爱主导了超级回报
item.description: 投资者对欧洲的热情正在成为今年柏林超级回报私人资本会议的主旋律之一。【原文：Investor enthusiasm toward Europe is emerging as one of the dominant themes at this year’s SuperReturn private capital conference in Berlin.】
